assignments.rationale: Characteristic first-order Raman mode representing in-plane vibrations of sp2 carbon atoms in hexagonal lattice structure
assignments.literature_reference: Ferrari, A.C. et al. (2006). Physical Review Letters, 97(18), 187401. DOI: 10.1103/PhysRevLett.97.187401

assignments.rationale: Similar spectral position indicating presence of sp2 carbon clusters with structural disorder
assignments.literature_reference: Tuinstra, F. & Koenig, J.L. (1970). Journal of Chemical Physics, 53(3), 1126-1130. DOI: 10.1063/1.1674108

assignments.rationale: Consistent peak position for radial breathing modes in single-wall carbon nanotubes

summary.analysis_overview: Peak at 1579.94 cm⁻¹ strongly indicates sp2 carbon system with high structural order
summary.key_literature_findings: Consistent with well-established G-band characteristics of graphitic carbon materials
summary.alternative_considerations: Slight variations could indicate structural modifications or presence of defects

references: Ferrari, A.C. et al. (2006). Physical Review Letters, 97(18), 187401.
Tuinstra, F. & Koenig, J.L. (1970). Journal of Chemical Physics, 53(3), 1126-1130.

assignments.rationale: Characteristic peak associated with sp2 carbon materials, representing a breathing mode of six-atom rings involving defects and disorder in the carbon lattice
assignments.literature_reference: Ferrari, A.C. et al. (2006). Physical Review Letters, 97(26), 267401. DOI: 10.1103/PhysRevLett.97.267401

assignments.rationale: High-frequency peak characteristic of sp2 carbon nanomaterials, sensitive to layer number and structural defects in carbon nanostructures
High-frequency peak potentially related to sp3 carbon bonding configurations in amorphous carbon materials
assignments.literature_reference: Casiraghi, C. et al. (2005). Diamond and Related Materials, 14(9), 1464-1470. DOI: 10.1016/j.diamond.2005.03.032

summary.analysis_overview: Peak at 2670.19 cm⁻¹ is characteristic of sp2 carbon materials, most likely representing the D' peak in graphene or graphitic structures
summary.key_literature_findings: Consistent with established Raman spectroscopy of carbon nanomaterials, showing characteristic high-frequency peaks associated with carbon lattice vibrations
summary.alternative_considerations: Peak could represent variations in carbon nanostructures, with slight shifts potentially indicating structural differences

references: Ferrari, A.C. et al. (2006). Physical Review Letters, 97(26), 267401.
Casiraghi, C. et al. (2005). Diamond and Related Materials, 14(9), 1464-1470.
